document_title: Rash on chest (breast): Causes, signs, treatment, prevention
subsection_name: phat-ban-o-nguc.json_3_When should someone with a breast rash see a doctor?
subsection_content:
Doctors recommend that women should see a specialist for examination and examination immediately if the breast rash does not respond to self-care at home. In particular, cases with symptoms accompanied by rashes as described below should be examined immediately:
Fever or pain; So hurt.; Signs and symptoms of rash get worse; Wounds heal slowly or do not heal; Red streaks come from the rash.; Yellow or green fluid oozing from the rash; Feel a lump or lump underneath the area with the red rash.; Swollen lymph nodes in the armpit or neck; Flat or inverted nipples; Breast skin is rough like orange peel.
Delayed treatment can cause the disease to get worse, negatively affecting your health. Therefore, instead of buying your own medicine to apply or take orally, take the time to go to the hospital for a checkup if your chest rash does not go away for many days.
subsection_title: phat ban o nguc.json. When should someone with a breast rash see a doctor?
